io.radar.sdk

Class Radar

  • io.radar.sdk.Radar

  • public class Radar

    The top-level class used to interact with the Radar SDK. For more information, see https://radar.io/documentation/sdk.

    See Also:
    https://radar.io/documentation/sdk

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Radar INSTANCE
      The top-level class used to interact with the Radar SDK. For more information, see https://radar.io/documentation/sdk.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void acceptEvent(java.lang.String eventId, java.lang.String verifiedPlaceId)
      Accepts an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.
      static void acceptEvent(java.lang.String eventId)
      Accepts an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.
      static java.lang.String getDescription()
      An optional description for the user, displayed in the dashboard. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify
      static org.json.JSONObject getMetadata()
      An optional set of custom key-value pairs for the user.
      static Radar.RadarPlacesProvider getPlacesProvider()
      The provider for Places data. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-places.
      static java.lang.String getUserId()
      A stable unique ID for the user. Until you identify the user, Radar will automatically identify the user by deviceId (Android ID). See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify.
      static void initialize(java.lang.String publishableKey)
      Initializes the Radar SDK. publishableKey may only be null if you created a radar_pk string resource. Call this method from the main thread in your Application class before calling any other Radar methods. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize.
      static void initialize()
      Initializes the Radar SDK. publishableKey may only be null if you created a radar_pk string resource. Call this method from the main thread in your Application class before calling any other Radar methods. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize.
      static boolean isTracking()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether tracking has been started.
      static void rejectEvent(java.lang.String eventId)
      Rejects an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.
      static void setDescription(java.lang.String value)
      An optional description for the user, displayed in the dashboard. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify

      An optional set of custom key-value pairs for the user.

      A stable unique ID for the user. Until you identify the user, Radar will automatically identify the user by deviceId (Android ID). See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify.
      static void startTracking()
      Starts tracking the user's location in the background. Before calling this method, the user must have granted location permissions for the app. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.
      static void startTracking(RadarTrackingOptions trackingOptions)
      Starts tracking the user's location in the background. Before calling this method, the user must have granted location permissions for the app. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.
      static void stopTracking()
      Stops tracking the user's location in the background. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.
      static void trackOnce(Radar.RadarCallback callback)
      Tracks the user's location once in the foreground. Before calling this method, the user must have granted location permissions for the app.
      void trackOnce(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function4<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarEvent[],? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarUser,kotlin.Unit> block)
      Kotlin lambda binding for Radar.trackOnce.
      static void updateLocation(android.location.Location location, Radar.RadarCallback callback)
      Manually updates the user's location. Be careful not to exceed the rate limit of 1 request per second per user or 60 requests per hour per user. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual.

      Kotlin lambda binding for Radar.updateLocation.

    • Field Detail

      • INSTANCE

        public static Radar INSTANCE

        The top-level class used to interact with the Radar SDK. For more information, see https://radar.io/documentation/sdk.

        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(java.lang.String publishableKey)

        Initializes the Radar SDK. publishableKey may only be null if you created a radar_pk string resource. Call this method from the main thread in your Application class before calling any other Radar methods. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize.

        Parameters:
        publishableKey - Your publishable API key. May only be null if you created a radar_pk string resource.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize

      • initialize

        public static void initialize()

        Initializes the Radar SDK. publishableKey may only be null if you created a radar_pk string resource. Call this method from the main thread in your Application class before calling any other Radar methods. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize.

        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize

      • getUserId

        public static java.lang.String getUserId()

        A stable unique ID for the user. Until you identify the user, Radar will automatically identify the user by deviceId (Android ID). See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify.

        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify

      • setUserId

        public static void setUserId(java.lang.String value)

        A stable unique ID for the user. Until you identify the user, Radar will automatically identify the user by deviceId (Android ID). See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify.

        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify

        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify

        The provider for Places data. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-places.

        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-places

        public static void setPlacesProvider(Radar.RadarPlacesProvider value)

        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-places

      • startTracking

        public static void startTracking()

        Starts tracking the user's location in the background. Before calling this method, the user must have granted location permissions for the app. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.

        This calls Radar.startTrackingoptions with default configuration.

        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background, Radar.startTrackingoptions

      • startTracking

        public static void startTracking(RadarTrackingOptions trackingOptions)

        Starts tracking the user's location in the background. Before calling this method, the user must have granted location permissions for the app. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.

        This version of startTracking accepts a class RadarTrackingOptions instance for configuring tracking behavior.

        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background, class RadarTrackingOptions

      • stopTracking

        public static void stopTracking()

        Stops tracking the user's location in the background. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.

        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background

      • isTracking

        public static boolean isTracking()

        Returns a boolean indicating whether tracking has been started.

        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether tracking has been started.

      • trackOnce

        public static void trackOnce(Radar.RadarCallback callback)

        Tracks the user's location once in the foreground. Before calling this method, the user must have granted location permissions for the app.

        Parameters:
        callback - An optional callback.

      • trackOnce

        public void trackOnce(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function4<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarEvent[],? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarUser,kotlin.Unit> block)

        Kotlin lambda binding for Radar.trackOnce.

        See Also:
        Radar.trackOnce

      • updateLocation

        public static void updateLocation(android.location.Location location,
                                  Radar.RadarCallback callback)

        Manually updates the user's location. Be careful not to exceed the rate limit of 1 request per second per user or 60 requests per hour per user. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual.

        Parameters:
        location - A location for the user.
        callback - An optional callback.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual

      • updateLocation

        public void updateLocation(android.location.Location location,
                           kotlin.jvm.functions.Function4<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarEvent[],? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarUser,kotlin.Unit> block)

        Kotlin lambda binding for Radar.updateLocation.

        See Also:
        Radar.updateLocation

      • acceptEvent

        public static void acceptEvent(java.lang.String eventId,
                               java.lang.String verifiedPlaceId)

        Accepts an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.

        Parameters:
        eventId - The ID of the event to accept.
        verifiedPlaceId - For place entry events, the ID of the verified place. May be null.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify

      • acceptEvent

        public static void acceptEvent(java.lang.String eventId)

        Accepts an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.

        Parameters:
        eventId - The ID of the event to accept.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify

      • rejectEvent

        public static void rejectEvent(java.lang.String eventId)

        Rejects an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.

        Parameters:
        eventId - The ID of the event to reject.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify
